name: barn
basicDescription: Normal sized barn for animals

name: bigBarn
basicDescription: Huge barn for animals

name: bigBarn
basicDescription: Huge barn for animals

name: grassStarter
basicDescription: Place this on your farm to start a new patch of grass.
longDescription: Instantly places a patch of Grass when used on the ground.  Over time, it'll grow and spread to surrounding tiles.  Grass can be harvested with the Sycthe to produce Hay once a Silo is built.  On Winter 1st, all grass on the farm will die.

name: sugar
basicDescription: Adds sweetness to pastries and candies.  Too much can be unhealthy.
longDescription: A cooking ingredient used in many recipes. Using a Mill, three Sugars can be crafted from one Beet.  Beets placed inside will appear as Sugar beside the Mill the next morning.  Sugar made this way is profitable when using regular or silver quality Beets at 150g for three Sugars.  However it is better to create Beet Pickles using the preserves jar to sell at 250g.

name: wheatFlour
basicDescription: A common cooking ingredient made from crushed wheat seeds.
longDescription: A cooking ingredient that can be consumed by itself.  One Wheat Flour can be crafted from one Wheat using a Mill.  Wheat placed inside the Mill will appear in the box beside the Mill the next morning.  Doing this is profitable at 50g per item.  It can then be cooked into Bread for another 10g profit, but using the Wheat to create Beer is more profitable at 200g per item.

name: rice
basicDescription: A basic grain often served under vegetables.
longDescription: A cooking ingredient that can be used in a variety of recipes.  I like to eat it everyday.

name: oil
basicDescription: All purpose cooking oil.
longDescription: An Artison Good and common cooking ingredient made from the Oil Maker.  There is no quality rating so its sell price doesn't benefit from quality increeases.  Also it's sell price doesn't benefit from the Artisan Profession.  Oil made from base quality Sunflowers, cultivated sunflower seeds and all qualities of corn is profitable, though corn is more profitable in the Keg or Preserves Jar.  The processing times vary by ingredient.  1 Corn takes 16.66 hours, 1 Sunflower Seeds takes 53.33 hours and 1 Sunflower takes 1 hour.

name: vinegar
basicDescription: An Aged fermented liquid used in many cooking recipes.
longDescription: Used as a cooking ingredient that can be used in a variety of recipes.

name: basicFertilizer
basicDescription: Improves soil quality a little, increasing your chance to grow quality crops. Mix into tilled soil.
longDescription: A Fertilizer that helps by improving soil quality. It can be crafted with a recipe gained through Farming Level 1. It must be placed on tilled soil before planting a seed.  It affects only the basic harvest (Potatoes, Blueberries, Cranberries, etc.), meaning that extra crops gained at a single harvest will be regular quality.

name: qualityFertilizer
basicDescription: Improves soil quality, increasing your chance to grow quality crops. Mix into tilled soil.
longDescription: A Fertilizer that improves the chance to grow a Quality Crop. It can be crafted with a recipe gained through Farming Level 9. It may occasionally be sold by the Travelling Card for 100-1000g. It must be placed on tilled soil before planting a seed.  It affects only the basic harvest (Potatoes, Blueberries, Cranberries, etc.), meaning that extra crops gained at a single harvest will be regular quality.

name: sweetGemBerry
source: Rare Seed grown in the Fall
basicDescription: It's by far the sweetest thing you've ever smelled.
longDescription: The Sweet Gem Berry is a crop that grows from a Rare Seed after 24 days. It is not considered a Fruit or Vegetable and thus cannot be used in a Keg or Preserves Jar. It also does not benefit from the Tiller profession. It can be purchased from the Traveling Cart for Gold.png9,000-15,000g. Rare Seeds can be purchased from the Traveling Cart for Gold.png1,000g in Spring & Summer, or for Gold.png600-1,000g in any season. Rare Seeds can also be produced from a Sweet Gem Berry using the Seed Maker. Despite its high value, the berry is regarded as a neutral gift by everyone in Stardew Valley. However, if you give one to Old Master Cannoli in the Secret Woods, you will get a Stardrop in return, and your Energy will increase permanently. In multiplayer, only one berry needs to be given for all players to receive a Stardrop.

name: rareSeed
source: Traveling Cart in Spring and Summer
basicDescription: Sow in fall. Takes all season to grow.
longDescription: The Rare Seed is a type of seed. A mature plant yields a Sweet Gem Berry. One to five Rare Seeds can be purchased at the Traveling Cart for Gold.png1,000g each during Spring and Summer. During any season, there is also a 1.26% chance that the merchant will be selling 1-5 Rare Seeds for Gold.png600-1,000g each. (You may see Rare Seeds occupying two slots in the merchant's offerings in Spring and Summer). Rare Seeds can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. Despite the description stating that this seed 'takes all season to grow', it takes only 24 days. If using Speed-Gro or Deluxe Speed-Gro, the player has up to Day 7 of Fall to plant this seed, and it will be harvestable before Winter.

name: basicRetainingSoil
basicDescription: This soil has a chance of staying watered overnight. Mix into tilled soil.
longDescription: A fertilizer that helps by keeping soil watered.  Can be placed on tilled soil before or after planting a seed, or at any stage of crop growth.  The chance for retaining water is about 33%.  The recipe can be obtained at Farming Level 4.

name: qualityRetainingSoil
basicDescription: This soil has a good chance of staying watered overnight. Mix into tilled soil.
longDescription: A fertilizer that helps by keeping soil watered.  Can be placed on tilled soil before or after planting a seed, or at any stage of crop growth.  The chance for retaining water is about 66%.  The recipe can be obtained at Farming Level 7 and produces 2 items per craft.

name: speedGro
basicDescription: Stimulates leaf production. Guaranteed to increase growth rate by at least 10%. Mix into tilled soil.
longDescription: A Fertilizer that helps by speeding crop growth.  Can be placed on tilled soil before or after planting a seed, or at any stage of crop growth (but as of v1.2, there's a bug that prevents any effect unless applied before planting a seed). The recipe can be obtained at Farming Level 3 and produces 5 items per craft. Crafting is always cheaper than purchasing it regardless of the Clam quality.

name: deluxeSpeedGro
basicDescription: Stimulates leaf production. Guaranteed to increase growth rate by at least 25%. Mix into tilled soil.
longDescription: A Fertilizer that helps by speeding crop growth.  Can be placed on tilled soil before or after planting a seed, or at any stage of crop growth (but as of v1.2, there's a bug that prevents any effect unless applied before planting a seed).  The chance for retaining water is about 66%.  The recipe can be obtained at Farming Level 8 and produces 5 items per craft. Crafting is always cheaper than purchasing it regardless of the Clam quality.  It is sold at the Pierre's General Store in year 2 onwards.

name: wallpaper
basicDescription: Decorates the walls of one room.
longDescription: A new wallpaper is available at the store each day.  The wallpaper sold at JojaMart will be sold the next day at Pierre's.  It can also be bought from a Catalogue. Wallpaper is a one time use and does not stack.  They cover the whole room they're placed in and can be also placed on hallway walls between rooms.

name: flooring
basicDescription: Decorates the floor of one room.
longDescription: A new flooring is available at the store each day.  The flooring sold at JojaMart will be sold the next day at Pierre's.  It can also be bought from a Catalogue. Wallpaper is a one time use and does not stack.  They cover the whole room they're placed in and can be also placed on hallway walls between rooms.

name: cherrySapling
basicDescription: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Cherry Tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding 'tiles' are empty.
longDescription: A Fruit Tree that takes 28 days to grow into a Cherry Tree, after which will produce one fruit each day during the Spring.  Like all Fruit Trees, it will produce fruit all year round if planted in the Greenhouse. It is a good deal to buy it at the Traveling Cart if it is 3400g or less (which is the price at the General Store).

name: apricotSapling
basicDescription: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Apricot Tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding 'tiles' are empty.
longDescription: A Fruit Tree that takes 28 days to grow into an Apricot Tree, after which will produce one fruit each day during the Spring.  Like all Fruit Trees, it will produce fruit all year round if planted in the Greenhouse. It is a good deal to buy it at the Traveling Cart if it is 2000g or less (which is the price at the General Store).

name: orangeSapling
basicDescription: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Orange Tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding 'tiles' are empty.
longDescription: A Fruit Tree that takes 28 days to grow into an Orange Tree, after which will produce one fruit each day during the Summer.  Like all Fruit Trees, it will produce fruit all year round if planted in the Greenhouse. It is a good deal to buy it at the Traveling Cart if it is 4000g or less (which is the price at the General Store).

name: peachSapling
basicDescription: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Peach Tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding 'tiles' are empty.
longDescription: A Fruit Tree that takes 28 days to grow into an Peach Tree, after which will produce one fruit each day during the Summer.  Like all Fruit Trees, it will produce fruit all year round if planted in the Greenhouse. It is a good deal to buy it at the Traveling Cart if it is 6000g or less (which is the price at the General Store).

name: pomegranateSapling
basicDescription: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Pomegranate Tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding 'tiles' are empty.
longDescription: A Fruit Tree that takes 28 days to grow into an Pomegranate Tree, after which will produce one fruit each day during the Fall.  Like all Fruit Trees, it will produce fruit all year round if planted in the Greenhouse. It is a good deal to buy it at the Traveling Cart if it is 6000g or less (which is the price at the General Store).

name: appleSapling
basicDescription: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Apple Tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding 'tiles' are empty.
longDescription: A Fruit Tree that takes 28 days to grow into an Apple Tree, after which will produce one fruit each day during the Fall.  Like all Fruit Trees, it will produce fruit all year round if planted in the Greenhouse. It is a good deal to buy it at the Traveling Cart if it is 4000g or less (which is the price at the General Store).

name: catalogue
basicDescription: Provides unlimited access to all wallpapers and floors... from the convenience of your home!
longDescription: A piece of Furniture that once placed, allows the player to purchase every Wallpaper and Flooring item for 0g in unlimited quantity.  This item is similar to the Furniture Catalogue sold at the Carpenter's Shop which gives access to Furniture items.

name: bouquet
basicDescription: A gift that shows your romantic interest.
longDescription: A special gift that you can give to any or all marriage candidates whom you've gained an 8-heart friendship with. Giving this to a marriage candidate results in their status changing to boyfriend or girlfriend on the Social tab of the pause menu.  Giving this unfreezes the friendship level with each recipient allowing it to increase to 10 hearsts, and to decay (meaning friendship will go down if they are not talked to each day).

name: largePack
basicDescription: Unlocks the 2nd row of inventory (12 more slots, total 24).
longDescription: Available at the start of the game, this will unlock 12 more slots upon purchase.

name: deluxePack
basicDescription: Unlocks the 3rd row of inventory (12 more slots, total 36).
longDescription: Available after purchasing the Large Pack, this will unlock 12 more slots upon purchase.

name: parsnipSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the spring. Takes 4 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Parsnips when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 20g.

name: beanStarter
basicDescription: Plant these in the spring. Takes 10 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Yields multiple beans per harvest. Grows on a trellis.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Green Beans when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 60g.

name: cauliflowerSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the spring. Takes 12 days to produce a large cauliflower.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Cauliflower when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 80g. Nine seeds can be obtained from Gunther at the Museum after donating 5 items.

name: potatoSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the spring. Takes 6 days to mature, and has a chance of yielding multiple potatoes at harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Potatoes when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 50g.  Potato seeds have a random chance to produce extra potatoes partially based upon Daily Luck.

name: cactusSeeds
basicDescription: Can only be grown indoors. Takes 12 days to mature, and then produces fruit every 3 days.
longDescription: ACactus Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Cactus Fruit. They can be purchased only from Sandy at the Oasis for Gold.png150g. Cactus Seeds can be planted outdoors, but will be either missing or dead the next day. Cactus plants may only be grown in the Greenhouse or inside another building using a Garden Pot. Cactus Fruit harvested from Cactus Seeds will never be iridium quality. Iridium quality Cactus Fruit is obtainable only by Foraging in The Desert after choosing the Botanist Profession. Harvesting Cactus plants gives Farming experience points.

name: tulipBulb
basicDescription: Plant in spring. Takes 6 days to produce a colorful flower. Assorted colors.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Tulips when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 20g.

name: kaleSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the spring. Takes 6 days to mature. Harvest with the scythe.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Kale when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 70g.

name: jazzSeeds
basicDescription: Plant in spring. Takes 7 days to produce a blue puffball flower.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Blue Jazz flowers when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 30g.

name: garlicSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the spring. Takes 4 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Garlic when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 40g.  These are only available in the General Store starting from year 2.

name: melonSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer. Takes 12 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Melons when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 80g.  Nine seeds can be obtained from Gunther at the Museum after donating 10 items.

name: tomatoSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer. Takes 11 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Tomatoes when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 50g.  When harvested, each tomato plant gives 1 Tomato every 4 days, with a small random chance for more tomatoes.

name: blueberrySeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer. Takes 13 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Blueberries when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 80g.  When harvested, each blueberry plant gives 3 Blueberries every 4 days with a small chance formore Blueberries.

name: pepperSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Hot Peppers when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker as well as a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 40g.  When harvested each Hot Pepper plant gives 1 Hot Pepper every 3 days with a small chance for more Hot Peppers.

name: wheatSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with the scythe.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Wheat when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker as well as a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 10g.

name: radishSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer. Takes 6 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Radishes when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker as well as a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 40g.

name: poppySeeds
basicDescription: Plant in summer. Produces a bright red flower in 7 days.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Poppy flowers when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 100g.

name: spangleSeeds
basicDescription: Plant in summer. Takes 8 days to produce a vibrant tropical flower. Assorted colors.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Summer Spangle flowers when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 50g.

name: hopsStarter
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer. Takes 11 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Hops when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 60g.

name: cornSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 14 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Corn when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker as well as a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 150g. Corn plants continue to produces every 4 days.

name: sunflowerSeeds
basicDescription: Plant in summer or fall. Takes 8 days to produce a large sunflower. Yields more seeds at harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Sunflowers and 0-3 Sunflower Seeds when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the JoJaMart for 125g or potentially 100g at the Travelling Cart. It's sell price is 100g if it was purchased instead of harvested.  It can be used to create oil via an Oil Maker.

name: redCabbageSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer. Takes 9 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Red Cabbage when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. This is only available at the General Store and Night Market starting year 2. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 100g.

name: eggplantSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the fall. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Eggplants when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker and has a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 20g. When harvested, each Eggplant bush gives 1 Eggplant for every 5 days, with a very small random chance for more Eggplants

name: cornSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 14 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Corn when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker and has a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 150g. When harvested, each Corn plant gives 1 Corn for every 4 days.

name: pumpkinSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the fall. Takes 13 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Pumpkins when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker and has a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 150g.

name: bokChoySeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the fall. Takes 4 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Bok Choy when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 50g.

name: yamSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the fall. Takes 10 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Bok Choy when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 60g.

name: cranberrySeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the fall. Takes 7 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Cranberries when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 240 or possibly 180g at the Travelling Cart.  When harvested each plant gives 2 Cranberries every 5 days with a small chance for more Cranberries.

name: fairySeeds
basicDescription: Plant in fall. Takes 12 days to produce a mysterious flower. Assorted Colors.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Fairy Rose flowers when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 200g.

name: amaranthSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the fall. Takes 7 days to grow. Harvest with the scythe.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Amaranth when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 70g.

name: grapeStarter
basicDescription: Plant these in the fall. Takes 10 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Grapes when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 60g. Continues to produces grapes every 3 days

name: artichokeSeeds
basicDescription: Plant these in the fall. Takes 8 days to mature.
longDescription: A type of seed which grows and produces Grapes when mature. These can be obtained via the Seed Maker or potentially from Mixed Seeds. It is cheapest to buy at the General Store or Night Market for 30g.  It is only available to buy at the General Store or Night Market starting year 2 but can be bought at the Travelling Cart from the start for 100g-1000g.

name: energyTonic
basicDescription: Restores a lot of energy.
longDescription: Restores a lot of energy.  Use it after a long day of work.

name: muscleRemedy
basicDescription: When you've pushed your body too hard, drink this to remove 'Exhaustion'
longDescription: Use this when you're tired.  Helpful after a long day of work.

name: copperOre
source: Blacksmith, The Mines, Fishing, Artifact Spot, Geodes, Panning, Traveling Cart
basicDescription: A common ore that can be smelted into bars
longDescription: The Mines (Levels 31-39) have a high concentration of copper nodes. The surrounding regular rocks also have a high probability of dropping a single copper ore. Copper Ore is obtained from copper nodes with a pickaxe. Mining a copper node will yield between 1 and 3 copper ore. The Miner Profession can further increase this.  Copper ore can be smelted in a Furnace to create a Copper Bar. The smelting requires 5 copper ore and 1 coal to begin and takes 30 in-game minutes to complete. Can be bought at the Blacksmith for 75g each in year 1 and 150g each in year 2+.

name: ironOre
source: Blacksmith, The Mines, Fishing, Artifact Spot, Geodes, Panning, Traveling Cart
basicDescription: A fairly common ore that can be smelted into bars.
longDescription: The Mines (Levels 41 - 79) have a high concentration of Iron Nodes with potential abundance at Levels 70 - 79. Iron Ore is obtained from Iron nodes with a pickaxe. Mining an Iron Node will yield between 1 and 3 Iron Ore. The Miner Profession can further increase this.  Iron ore can be smelted in a Furnace to create an Iron Bar. The smelting requires 5 iron ore and 1 coal to begin and takes 2 hours to complete. Can be bought at the Blacksmith for 150g each in year 1 and 250g each in year 2+.

name: coal
source: Charcoal Kiln, Recycling Marchine, Blacksmith, The Mines, Fishing, Geodes, Panning, Traveling Cart
basicDescription: A combustible rock that is useful for crafting and smelting.
longDescription: Coal is a basic resource. It can be obtained in many different ways, primarily from rocks or Dust Sprites in The Mines, purchased from Clint at the Blacksmith shop, or using a Charcoal Kiln. It may also be produced by recycling trash or found in Fishing Treasure Chests. A random amount of coal may be found in addition to metal ores by Panning. Coal is used in some crafting recipes and is necessary for smelting ore or Quartz in a furnace. A Charcoal Kiln can be used to convert 10 wood into 1 coal. Coal purchased at the Blacksmith costs 150g during year 1, so it is cheaper in year 1 to buy 10 wood for 100g from Robin at the Carpenter's Shop and convert that wood into coal in the Charcoal Kiln. After year 1, wood pricing increases to 50g per piece but coal increases to only 250g, so it is cheaper to purchase coal directly.

name: goldOre
source: Blacksmith, The Mines, Fishing, Frozen Geode, Magma Geode, Omni Geode, Panning, Traveling Cart
basicDescription: A fairly common ore that can be smelted into bars.
longDescription: Gold Ore is a resource that can be placed in a furnace, along with coal, to create a Gold Bar. Each bar requires 5 gold ore and one coal to create, taking about five in-game hours. Gold ore can be mined from gold nodes in the Mines at levels 80+, in the Skull Cavern rarely at levels 60+ and more commonly at levels 80+, and has a chance to spawn in the Quarry. Gold ore can also be found by breaking boxes and barrels in the mines. Other random sources of gold ore are fishing treasure chests and beachfront Artifact Spots. Gold ore may also be found inside Frozen Geodes, Magma Geodes, or Omni Geodes, or from Panning. The Traveling Cart may occasionally sell it for 100-1,000g. Gold ore can be sold for 25g each. It can be purchased for 400g each from the Blacksmith in year 1, totaling 2,000g per bar. In year 2+, it can be purchased from the Blacksmith for 750g each, totaling 3,750g per bar.

name: copperHoe
basicDescription: It is used primarily to till soil for Farming, and to dig up Artifact Spots.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Copper Hoe will increase the maximum area of effect to 3 tiles, in a line in front of you via holding down the action button.

name: steelHoe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Copper Hoe
basicDescription: It is used primarily to till soil for Farming, and to dig up Artifact Spots.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Steel Hoe will increase the maximum area of effect to 5 tiles, in a line in front of you via holding down the action button.

name: goldHoe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Steel Hoe
basicDescription: It is used primarily to till soil for Farming, and to dig up Artifact Spots.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Gold Hoe will increase the maximum area of effect to 3x3 tiles, in a line in front of you via holding down the action button.

name: iridiumHoe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Gold Hoe
basicDescription: It is used primarily to till soil for Farming, and to dig up Artifact Spots.
longDescription: Upgrading to an Iridium Hoe will increase the maximum area of effect to 6x3 tiles, in a line in front of you via holding down the action button.

name: copperPickaxe
basicDescription: It is used mainly for breaking stones and picking up placed equipment or furniture.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Copper Pickaxe will allow you to break large rocks in the mine. These give 10 stone. It reduces the hits needed for other rocks.

name: steelPickaxe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Copper Pickaxe
basicDescription: It is used mainly for breaking stones and picking up placed equipment or furniture.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Steel Pickaxe will allow you to break boulders on The Farm. Can mine the barrier inside the mine that blocks the player from talking with Dwarf. It further reduces the hits needed for other rocks.

name: goldPickaxe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Steel Pickaxe
basicDescription: It is used mainly for breaking stones and picking up placed equipment or furniture.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Gold Pickaxe allows you to break any meteorites that land on your farm. It further reduces the hits needed for other rocks.

name: iridiumPickaxe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Gold Pickaxe
basicDescription: It is used mainly for breaking stones and picking up placed equipment or furniture.
longDescription: Upgrading to an Iridium Pickaxe further reduces the hits needed for other rocks.

name: copperAxe
basicDescription: The Axe is a tool used to chop branches, trees and small stumps, as well as for removing or harvesting certain objects, especially important for obtaining Wood.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Copper Axe will allow you to chop Large Stumps. 8 hits to chop a fully-grown tree, and 4 hits for a small stump.

name: steelAxe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Copper Axe
basicDescription: The Axe is a tool used to chop branches, trees and small stumps, as well as for removing or harvesting certain objects, especially important for obtaining Wood.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Steel Axe will allow you to chop Large Logs. 6 hits to chop a fully-grown tree, and 3 hits for a small stump. The Steel Axe is required to remove the Large Log that blocks the entrance to the Secret Woods.

name: goldAxe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Steel Axe
basicDescription: The Axe is a tool used to chop branches, trees and small stumps, as well as for removing or harvesting certain objects, especially important for obtaining Wood.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Gold Axe allows you to only need 4 hits to chop a fully-grown tree, and 2 hits for a small stump. 2 hits for a stage 4 tree, and one hit for a stage 3 tree and below.

name: iridiumAxe
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Golden Axe
basicDescription: The Axe is a tool used to chop branches, trees and small stumps, as well as for removing or harvesting certain objects, especially important for obtaining Wood.
longDescription: Upgrading to an Iridium Axe allows you to only need 2 hits to chop a fully-grown tree, and 1 hit for a small stump. 1 hit for a stage 4 tree and below.

name: copperWateringCan
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Watering Can
basicDescription: The Watering Can is a tool obtained at the beginning of the game that is used to water Crops.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Copper Watering Can will have the capacity increased to 55 charges. Also increases maximum area of effect to 3 tiles in a straight line.

name: steelWateringCan
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Copper Watering Can
basicDescription: The Watering Can is a tool obtained at the beginning of the game that is used to water Crops.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Steel Watering Can will have the capacity increased to 70 charges. Also increases maximum area of effect to 5 tiles in a straight line.

name: goldWateringCan
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Steel Watering Can
basicDescription: The Watering Can is a tool obtained at the beginning of the game that is used to water Crops.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Gold Watering Can will have the capacity increased to 85 charges. Also increases maximum area of effect to a 3x3 area (9 corresponding tiles).

name: iridiumWateringCan
source: Blacksmith by upgrading a Gold Watering Can
basicDescription: The Watering Can is a tool obtained at the beginning of the game that is used to water Crops.
longDescription: Upgrading to a Iridium Watering Can will have the capacity increased to 100 charges. Also increases maximum area of effect to a 6x3 area (18 corresponding tiles)

name: jojaCola
source: Fishing, JojaMart, Vending Machine, Soda Machine, Garbage Cans
basicDescription: The flagship product of Joja Corporation
longDescription: Joja Cola is a type of trash. It can be found in all fishing spots during all seasons and in Garbage Cans. It can also be purchased at JojaMart for 75g or from the Vending Machine in The Stardrop Saloon. Players who choose to complete the Joja Warehouse instead of the Community Center will be rewarded with a Soda Machine that produces one Joja Cola per day. It is the only trash item that can be purchased. Along with the Rotten Plant, it cannot be recycled. When caught while fishing, Joja Cola gives 3 Fishing XP.

name: jojaWallpaper
basicDescription: Decorates the walls of one room
longDescription: A great way to show your love and support to the Joja corporatation.

name: jColaLight
basicDescription: Can be placed inside your house.
longDescription: Another great way to show your love and support to the Joja corporatation.

name: minecarts
basicDescription: Repairs the minecart system that runs between the bus stop, the mountains, and Pelican Town.
longDescription: Repairs the minecart system that runs between the bus stop, the mountains, and Pelican Town.

name: minecarts
basicDescription: Repairs the minecart system that runs between the bus stop, the mountains, and Pelican Town.
longDescription: Destinations available from Town. The Minecart is a method of travel unlocked after completing the Boiler Room Bundles or by purchasing it from the Joja Community Development Form at JojaMart for 15,000g. After the Boiler room bundle is completed the 'minecart' is not usable till the day after because the Junimos fix it that night. Minecarts allow you to travel between four destinations throughout Stardew Valley.

name: panning
basicDescription: Removes the glimmering boulder near the mine entrance.
longDescription: Removes the glimmering boulder near the mine entrance.

name: bridge
basicDescription: Repairs the broken bridge in the mountains. The broken bridge east of The Mines will be repaired, enabling access to the Quarry.
longDescription: Repairs the broken bridge in the mountains. The broken bridge east of The Mines will be repaired, enabling access to the Quarry.

name: greenhouse
basicDescription: Repairs the old ruins on the farm, turning it into a greenhouse.
longDescription: Repairs the old ruins on the farm, turning it into a greenhouse.

name: bus
basicDescription: Repairs the bus that runs to Calico Desert.
longDescription: Repairs the bus that runs to Calico Desert.

name: salad
basicDescription: A healthy garden salad.
longDescription: Salad is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. It is also available for purchase daily at The Stardrop Saloon for 220g and may randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Saturdays.

name: bread
basicDescription: A crusty baguette.
longDescription: Bread is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. Note: this recipe is profitable - it will always result in profit when using Wheat Flour made in the Mill. Bread is available at the Stardrop Saloon every day for 120g, and randomly from Krobus's shop on Saturdays. The recipe can be obtained at Stardrop Saloon for 500g or via The Queen of Sauce (TV) on Year 1, Summer day 28

name: spaghetti
basicDescription: An old favorite
longDescription: Spaghetti is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. It is also available every day at The Stardrop Saloon for 240g and may randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Saturdays.  It can be obtained from Lewis via Mail after friendship has at least 3 hearts.

name: pizza
basicDescription: It's popular for all the right reasons.
longDescription: Pizza is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. It is also available for purchase daily at The Stardrop Saloon for 600g and may randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Saturdays. The recipe can be obtained at Stardrop Saloon for 600g or via The Queen of Sauce (TV) on Year 2, Spring day 7

name: coffee
source: Keg, Night Market for free, The Saloon
basicDescription: It smells delicious.  This is sure to give you a boost.
longDescription: Coffee is an edible Artisan Good made by placing 5 Coffee Beans inside a Keg. It is also available at The Saloon for 300g. When consumed, it grants the player a unique speed boost for 1m 23s that stacks with speed boosts from other food items. The speed of the players horse is also increased. If consumed after midnight, Coffee does not give a speed boost until the player wakes up in the morning. Despite being considered an Artisan Good, the sale price of Coffee does not benefit from the Artisan Profession. Note that 5 beans of the same quality (normal, silver, or gold) must be used to make coffee; the keg will not accept beans that are not in one stack of 5.

name: hashbrownsRecipe
source: The Stardrop Saloon or Queen of Sauce
basicDescription: Unlocks the ability to create Hashbrowns.
longDescription: Also obtainable via The Queen of Sauce on Year 2 of Spring 14.

name: omeletRecipe
source: The Stardrop Saloon or Queen of Sauce
basicDescription: Unlocks the ability to create Omelet.
longDescription: Also obtainable via The Queen of Sauce on Year 1 of Spring 28.

name: pancakesRecipe
source: The Stardrop Saloon or Queen of Sauce
basicDescription: Unlocks the ability to create Pancakes.
longDescription: Also obtainable via The Queen of Sauce on Year 1 of Summer 14.

name: breadRecipe
source: The Stardrop Saloon or Queen of Sauce
basicDescription: Unlocks the ability to create Bread.
longDescription: Also obtainable via The Queen of Sauce on Year 1 of Summer 28.

name: tortillaRecipe
source: The Stardrop Saloon or Queen of Sauce
basicDescription: Unlocks the ability to create Tortilla.
longDescription: Also obtainable via The Queen of Sauce on Year 1 of Fall 7.

name: pizzaRecipe
source: The Stardrop Saloon or Queen of Sauce
basicDescription: Unlocks the ability to create Pizza.
longDescription: Also obtainable via The Queen of Sauce on Year 2 of Spring 7.

name: makiRollRecipe
source: The Stardrop Saloon or Queen of Sauce
basicDescription: Unlocks the ability to create Maki Rolls.
longDescription: Also obtainable via The Queen of Sauce on Year 1 of Summer 21.

name: cheese
basicDescription: It's your basic cheese.
longDescription: Cheese is an Artisan Good made from the Cheese Press, taking 3.3 hours. Using Milk will produce normal quality Cheese, while Large Milk will produce gold quality Cheese. Cheese can be placed inside a Cask to age from normal quality to silver, gold, and eventually iridium quality. Iridium quality doubles the base sell price of Cheese. Normal, silver, and gold quality Cheese can be prematurely removed from a cask at any time by striking the cask with an Axe, Hoe, or Pickaxe.

name: milk
basicDescription: A jug of cow's milk.
longDescription: Milk is an animal product obtained from a Cow by using a Milk Pail. It can also be obtained from Sandy at random, who will comment that the player looks thirsty. When a cow has a sufficient friendship and mood level, it can produce a Large Milk, which is more valuable. Milk can be used to make the following Artisan Goods. Note that regular Milk always produces regular quality Cheese, while Large Milk always produces gold-quality Cheese. The quality of the Milk is not a factor.

name: largeMilk
basicDescription: A large jug of cow's milk.
longDescription: Large Milk is an animal product obtained from a Cow with sufficient friendship and mood. It can also randomly rotate into the Traveling Cart's stock for 570-1,000g. Large Milk can be used to make the following Artisan Goods. Note that regular Milk always produces regular quality Cheese, while Large Milk always produces gold-quality Cheese. The quality of the Milk is not a factor. Cheese may be aged in Casks to increase its quality.

name: completeBreakfast
basicDescription: You'll feel ready to take on the world!
longDescription: Complete Breakfast is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. The recipe can be obtained via the Queen of Sauce on Spring 21 of Year 2.

name: friedEgg
basicDescription: Sunny-side up.
longDescription: Fried Egg is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse.

name: hashbrowns
basicDescription: Crispy and golden-brown!
longDescription: Hashbrowns are a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. The recipe can be obtained during Year 2 on Spring 14. or at the Saloon for 250g.

name: oil
basicDescription: All purpose cooking oil.
longDescription: Oil is an Artisan Good and common cooking ingredient made from the Oil Maker. It can also be obtained from Pierre's General Store for 200g. Oil is given no quality rating, so its sell price doesn't benefit from quality increases. In addition, despite being labeled an 'Artisan Good' in-game, its sell price does not benefit from the Artisan Profession. Its main benefit lies in its use as a cooking ingredient. However, oil made from base quality sunflowers, cultivated sunflower seeds, and all qualities of corn is profitable, though corn is more profitable in the keg or preserves jar. Using a Sunflower to process Oil will be the fastest way, taking only about 60 in-game minutes.

name: corn
basicDescription: One of the most popular grains. The sweet, fresh cobs are a summer favorite.
longDescription: Corn is a vegetable crop that grows from Corn Seeds after 14 days. Can be grown in the Summer and Fall. If a Corn plant (of any growth stage) is in the ground on the 28th of Summer, it will continue growing on the 1st of Fall as though nothing had changed. Fertilizer in the ground underneath a Corn plant on Summer 28 will not disappear on Fall 1.

name: sunflower
basicDescription: A common misconception is that the flower turns so it's always facing the sun.
longDescription: The Sunflower is a flower crop that grows from Sunflower Seeds after 8 days. Unlike other flowers, they don't affect the type of Honey produced by nearby Bee Houses. Harvesting a sunflower will drop 1 Sunflower, and 0-3 Sunflower Seeds. The total seed drop often numbers around 75% to 90% of the number of sunflowers harvested. Sunflowers may be planted in both Summer and Fall. There is no difference in their behavior in either season. If a Sunflower plant (of any growth stage) is in the ground on the 28th of Summer, it will continue growing on the 1st of Fall as though nothing had changed. Fertilizer in the ground underneath a Sunflower plant on Summer 28 will not disappear on Fall 1.

name: pancakes
basicDescription: A double stack of fluffy, soft pancakes.
longDescription: Pancakes are a cooked dish. They are prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. The recipe can be obtained at the Stardrop Saloon for 500g or from the Queen of Sauce TV show on Year 1, Summer 14.

name: salmonDinner
basicDescription: The lemon spritz makes it special.
longDescription: Salmon Dinner is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. The recipe can be obtained from Gus through the mail after obtaining three hearts of friendship with him.

name: goldenPumpkin
source: Spirit's Eve Festival in the Fall
basicDescription: It's valuable but has no other purpose
longDescription: he Golden Pumpkin is obtained during the Spirit's Eve Festival. It can be sold through the Shipping Bin for 2,500g or gifted as a Universally Loved gift (despite its description). To obtain the Golden Pumpkin, head north after arriving at the festival. Make your way through the maze until you reach a sign that contains a question mark. Proceed through the bushes to the left of the sign, then move north into a cave. Continue east and then south until you reach the treasure chest with the Golden Pumpkin. The Golden Pumpkin is a universally hated gift in v1.2, which is the current version for Xbox. For players using computers, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4 or mobile devices, the Golden Pumpkin is a universally loved gift.

name: pearl
source: Night Market Festival in the Winter
basicDescription: A rare treasure from the sea.
longDescription: The Pearl is a special item that can be obtained only during the Night Market Festival. There is a 0.4% chance to catch it while fishing in the Fishing Submarine. Otherwise, it can be obtained inside the Mermaid Boat by clicking on the clam shells in the correct sequence. The correct sequence is listed in Secret Note #15. From left to right, 1-5-4-2-3. Only one Pearl may be obtained from the Mermaid Boat per player per save file. A Pearl cannot be replicated in a Crystalarium.

name: prismaticShard
source: Geodes, various monsters at low drop rates.
basicDescription: A very rare and powerful substance with unknown origins.
longDescription: It is one of the rarest items in the game. It can be obtained from Omni Geodes (0.4%), Iridium Nodes (4%), Mystic Stones (25%), Gem Nodes and Fishing Treasure Chests. It is also a rare drop from Serpents (0.1%), Mummies (0.1%), Shadow Brutes (0.05%), and Shadow Shaman (0.05%). They have a small chance (0.05%) to be dropped by any monster after the player has reached the bottom of The Mines. Prismatic Shards cannot be duplicated in a Crystalarium. A Prismatic Shard can be used in The Desert to obtain the Galaxy Sword. A bug exists where multiple Prismatic Shards will be removed from the inventory if they are all in the same stack when obtaining the Galaxy Sword. The Dwarvish Headstone in the graveyard contains a riddle explaining how to obtain the Galaxy Sword. A Prismatic Shard can also be offered to the Dark Shrine of Selfishness at the Witch's Hut, in order to turn children into doves (getting rid of them permanently).

name: rabbitsFoot
basicDescription: Some say it's lucky.
longDescription: The Rabbit's Foot is an animal product obtained from a Rabbit with sufficient friendship, mood, and daily luck. It can also occasionally be purchased from the Traveling Cart for 1,695-2,825g, or dropped by Serpents in the Skull Cavern. Luck buffs do not influence the chances of getting a rabbit's foot. In the Skull Cavern, the Serpent has a very low (0.8%) Chance of dropping a Rabbit's Foot.

name: honey
basicDescription: It's a sweet syrup produced by bees
longDescription: Honey is an Artisan Good made from the Bee House, using a variety of flowers. It does this every 4 days in every season other than Winter. It may be purchased from the Oasis on Fridays for Gold.png200g. Only flowers which are fully grown will have an effect on the type of honey produced. Flowers are not used up when a hive produces honey, and multiple hives can make honey from the same flower, so one flower can service a very large number of hives. If a Bee House has produced flower honey, but the flower is harvested before the honey, the honey will become 'Wild Honey.' Similarly, if a Bee House is removed with a tool while it has flower honey ready for harvesting, the honey will go into inventory as 'Honey', which is functionally identical to Wild Honey. Honey purchased from the Oasis or Traveling Cart is called 'Honey', and is also functionally identical to Wild Honey. Honey can be made into mead by placing it inside a keg.

name: wine
basicDescription: Drink in moderation.
longDescription: Wine is an Artisan Good made from the Keg, taking 7 days. It can also be received as a gift at the Feast of the Winter Star. The sell price of Wine depends on the fruit used (3  Base Fruit Value). When consumed, wine causes a Tipsy buff that decreases Speed by 1. The healing effect of Wine is the same no matter what fruit is used to make it. Note: It is possible to acquire Wine that has no base fruit (from the Traveling Cart or a Statue Of Endless Fortune, or as a gift at the Feast of the Winter Star). This item is simply titled 'Wine', and has a selling price of Gold.png400g (or Gold.png560g with the Artisan Profession). Wine can be placed inside a Cask to age from normal quality to silver, gold, and eventually iridium quality. Iridium quality doubles the base sell price of Wine. Wine takes the longest to age of any item in Casks. It takes 2 seasons of aging to go from basic wine to iridium quality wine. Normal, silver, and gold quality Wine can be prematurely removed from a cask at any time by striking the cask with an Axe, Hoe, or Pickaxe.

name: paleAle
basicDescription: Drink in moderation.
longDescription: Pale Ale is an Artisan Good made from the Keg using Hops, taking 1-2 days. It has the second highest profit per day of any crop used in the Keg (after Starfruit, 12  base Hops value) and takes less time compared to other crops (tied with Wheat). When consumed, Pale Ale causes a Tipsy buff that decreases Speed by 1. Pale Ale can be placed inside a Cask to age from normal quality to silver, gold, and eventually iridium quality. Iridium quality doubles the base sell price of Pale Ale. Normal, silver, and gold quality Pale Ale can be prematurely removed from a cask at any time by striking the cask with an Axe, Hoe, or Pickaxe.

name: beer
basicDescription: Drink in Moderation
longDescription: Beer is an Artisan Good made from the Keg using Wheat, taking 1-2 days. It is also available at The Saloon for 400g. It can also be received as a gift at the Feast of the Winter Star. When consumed, Beer causes a Tipsy Buff that decreases Speed by 1. Beer can be placed inside a Cask to age from normal quality to silver, gold, and eventually iridium quality. Iridium quality doubles the base sell price of Beer.

name: mead
basicDescription: A fermented beverage made from honey. Drink in moderation.
longDescription: Mead is an Artisan Good made from placing Honey inside a Keg, taking 10 hours. Unlike Wine and Juice however, the value of the Mead is not affected by the type of honey used. The sell price of Mead is Gold.png200g, and only aging or the Artisan Profession can increase it. Several types of Flower Honey sell for more than Mead, so the player can actually lose money by making Mead. When consumed, Mead causes a Tipsy buff that decreases Speed by 1. Mead can be placed inside a Cask to age from normal quality to silver, gold, and eventually iridium quality. Iridium quality doubles the base sell price of Mead. Normal, silver, and gold quality Mead can be prematurely removed from a cask at any time by striking the cask with an Axe, Hoe, or Pickaxe.

name: cheese
basicDescription: It's your basic cheese.
longDescription: Cheese is an Artisan Good made from the Cheese Press, taking 3.3 hours. Using Milk will produce normal quality Cheese, while Large Milk will produce gold quality Cheese. Cheese can be placed inside a Cask to age from normal quality to silver, gold, and eventually iridium quality. Iridium quality doubles the base sell price of Cheese. Normal, silver, and gold quality Cheese can be prematurely removed from a cask at any time by striking the cask with an Axe, Hoe, or Pickaxe.

name: goatCheese
basicDescription: Drink in moderation.
longDescription: Goat Cheese is an Artisan Good made by placing Goat Milk in a Cheese Press (takes 3.3 hours). Goat Cheese can be placed inside a Cask to age from normal quality to silver, gold, and eventually iridium quality. Iridium quality doubles the base sell price of Goat Cheese. Normal, silver, and gold quality Goat Cheese can be prematurely removed from a cask at any time by striking the cask with an Axe, Hoe, or Pickaxe.

name: juice
basicDescription: A sweet, nutritious beverage
longDescription: Juice is an Artisan Good made from the Keg, taking approximately 4 days. Ignore the selling price on this page.  The selling price depends on the base value of the vegetable input multiplied by 2.25. The healing effect of Juice is the same no matter what vegetable is used to make it. Although Wheat and Hops are classified as vegetables, when used with a Keg, wheat produces Beer and hops produce Pale Ale.

name: cloth
basicDescription: A bolt of fine wool cloth
longDescription: Cloth is an Artisan Good made from the Loom using Wool, taking 4 hours. It can also be made from recycling a Soggy Newspaper using the Recycling Machine, and is an occasional drop from Mummies (5% chance) when slain. Emily may occasionally send you a Cloth in the mail.

name: wool
basicDescription: Soft, fluffy wool
longDescription: Wool is an animal product obtained from a Rabbit or Sheep. Emily may also send you one Wool in the mail as a gift. Wool sells for a base price of Gold.png340g.

name: mayonnaise
basicDescription: It looks spreadable
longDescription: Mayonnaise is an Artisan Good made from the Mayonnaise Machine, taking 3 hours. Large White/Brown or Dinosaur eggs will produce Gold quality mayonnaise. Normal sized White and Brown eggs will produce regular quality Mayonnaise. The quality of the egg is not a factor in determining the quality of the mayonnaise.

name: duckEgg
basicDescription: It's still warm.
longDescription: The Duck Egg is an animal product obtained from a Duck. It may be placed in a Big or Deluxe Coop's incubator to create a Duck.

name: largeEgg
basicDescription: It's an uncommonly large egg!
longDescription: The Large Egg and the Large Brown Egg are animal products obtained from Chickens with sufficient friendship. Large Eggs produce Quality Mayonnaise when used with a Mayonnaise Machine. For cooking, regular and large eggs may be used interchangeably. Large Eggs can be hatched in an incubator, which comes with a Big or Deluxe Coop.

name: egg
basicDescription: A regular white/brown chicken egg.
longDescription: The Egg and the Brown Egg are animal products obtained from White, Brown, or Blue Chickens. Marnie may also gift you 12 eggs at the Feast of the Winter Star. Eggs can be hatched in an incubator, which comes with a Big or Deluxe Coop. Eggs can be used to make the following Artisan Goods. Note that regular eggs always produce regular quality Mayonnaise, while Large Eggs and Dinosaur Eggs always produce gold-quality Mayonnaise. The quality of the egg is not a factor.

name: largeBrownEgg
basicDescription: It's an uncommonly large brown egg!
longDescription: The Large Brown Egg are animal products obtained from Chickens with sufficient friendship. Large Eggs produce Quality Mayonnaise when used with a Mayonnaise Machine. For cooking, regular and large eggs may be used interchangeably. Large Eggs can be hatched in an incubator, which comes with a Big or Deluxe Coop.

name: brownEgg
basicDescription: A regular brown chicken egg.
longDescription: The Egg and the Brown Egg are animal products obtained from White, Brown, or Blue Chickens. Marnie may also gift you 12 eggs at the Feast of the Winter Star. Eggs can be hatched in an incubator, which comes with a Big or Deluxe Coop. Eggs can be used to make the following Artisan Goods. Note that regular eggs always produce regular quality Mayonnaise, while Large Eggs and Dinosaur Eggs always produce gold-quality Mayonnaise. The quality of the egg is not a factor.

name: duckMayonnaise
basicDescription: It's a rich, yellow mayonnaise
longDescription: Duck Mayonnaise is an Artisan Good made by placing a Duck Egg into a Mayonnaise Machine, taking 3 hours.

name: voidMayonnaise
basicDescription: A thick, black paste that smells like burnt hair.
longDescription: Void Mayonnaise is an Artisan Good made by placing a Void Egg inside the Mayonnaise Machine. It may be also be fished from the Witch's Swamp (25% chance if the player does not have one in inventory). Players may only fish a Void Mayonnaise from the Witch's Swamp while the Henchman is guarding the Witch's Hut. Gifting a Void Mayonnaise to the Henchman outside the Witch's Hut will allow players to pass during the quest Goblin Problem.

name: truffleOil
basicDescription: A gourmet cooking ingredient
longDescription: Truffle Oil is an Artisan Good made in the Oil Maker from a Truffle. It takes 5 to 6 hours to produce. Despite being listed as 'A gourmet cooking ingredient' there are no cooking recipes that use it, but it is used to make the Rain Totem.

name: truffle
basicDescription: A gourmet type of mushroom with a unique taste
longDescription: he Truffle is a type of mushroom that can only be spawned by a Pig on The Farm when the pig is outside the Barn. Since pigs do not go out of the barn in winter, they spawn no truffles in that season. Truffles sell for a base price of Gold.png625g. Despite being spawned by pigs, truffles are not considered to be animal produce, like eggs or milk. They do not receive a price increase from the Rancher profession. And despite being mushrooms, they technically are also not considered to be foraged items. They are not among the items included in the foraging category at the Stardew Valley Fair, nor are they labeled as 'Forage' in inventory. They do, however, benefit from the Gatherer and Botanist professions. Truffles not gathered on the 28th day of a season disappear on the following morning, the 1st day of the new season. On rare occasions, a Truffle can be purchased from the Traveling Cart for 1,875-3,125g.

name: pickles
basicDescription: A jar of your home-made pickles
longDescription: Jellies and pickles can be produced by inserting either a fruit or a vegetable in a preserves jar, respectively. The value of a single jar of jelly or pickles is equal to (2 * Base Crop Value + 50). Jelly and pickles are unaffected by the quality of the fruit or vegetable used. A preserves jar requires 4000 minutes to produce pickles or jelly. This will take 2-3 days, depending on sleep habits.

name: jelly
basicDescription: Gooey
longDescription: Jellies and pickles can be produced by inserting either a fruit or a vegetable in a preserves jar, respectively. The value of a single jar of jelly or pickles is equal to (2 * Base Crop Value + 50). Jelly and pickles are unaffected by the quality of the fruit or vegetable used. A preserves jar requires 4000 minutes to produce pickles or jelly. This will take 2-3 days, depending on sleep habits.

name: cheeseCauliflower
basicDescription: It smells great!
longDescription: Cheese Cauliflower is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse. It is shortened to 'Cheese Cauli.' in the stove menu in-game. The recipe can be obtained from Pam thru the mail after 3 hearts of friendship has been earned.

name: cauliflower
basicDescription: Valuable, but slow-growing.  Despite its pale color, the florets are packed with nutrients.
longDescription: Cauliflower is a vegetable crop that grows from Cauliflower Seeds after 12 days. Cauliflower is one of only three crops that can grow into a giant crop.

name: bakedFish
basicDescription: Baked fish on a bed of herbs
longDescription: Baked Fish is a cooked dish. It is prepared using the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse.  The recipe can be obtained through The Queen of Sauce on TV during Year 1 Summer 7.

name: sunfish
source: River in Spring/Summer from 6am to 7pm during sunny and windy weather.
basicDescription: A common river fish.
longDescription: The Sunfish is a fish that can be found in the river during Spring and Summer. It may also be purchased from the Traveling Cart for Gold.png100-1,000g, or found in Garbage Cans during Spring and Summer. The Sunfish may also be caught on the Riverlands Farm or on the Hill-top Farm.

name: pufferfish
basicDescription: Inflates when threatened
longDescription: The Pufferfish is a fish that can be caught at the beach, on sunny summer days between 12pm and 4pm. It can also be purchased from the Traveling Cart for Gold.png600-1,000g.

name: anchovy
basicDescription: A small silver fish found in the ocean.
longDescription: he Anchovy is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Spring and Fall. At higher Fishing skill, it may be easier to catch by casting less than the max distance.

name: tuna
basicDescription: A large fish that lives in the ocean
longDescription: The Tuna is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Summer and Winter. Though not common, it can also be found in trash cans.

name: sardine
basicDescription: A common ocean fish.
longDescription: The Tuna is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Summer and Winter. Though not common, it can also be found in trash cans.

name: bream
basicDescription: A fairly common river fish that becomes active at night.
longDescription: The Bream is a fish that can be found in the river during all seasons, after 6PM.

name: largemouthBass
basicDescription: basicDescription
longDescription: longDescription

name: smallmouthBass
basicDescription: A freshwater fish that is very sensitive to pollution
longDescription: The Smallmouth Bass is a fish that can be found in the river and forest pond during the Spring and Fall.

name: rainbowTrout
basicDescription: A freshwater trout with colorful markings.
longDescription: The Rainbow Trout is a fish that can be found in the river and mountain lake during the Summer.

name: salmon
source: River from 6AM-7PM in the Fall for any weather.
basicDescription: Swims upstream to lay its eggs.
longDescription: The Salmon is a fish that can be found in the river during the Fall. It may also be purchased from the Traveling Cart for 225-1,000g or found in Garbage Cans during Fall.

name: walleye
source: River, Mountain Lake, Forest Pond, Forest Farm Pond
basicDescription: A freshwater fish caught at night
longDescription: The Walleye is a fish that can be found in the river, lake, and forest pond during the Fall or Winter when it is raining. (A Rain Totem is required to make it rain in Winter.) It can also be found in Garbage Cans, during Fall and Winter, or it may randomly appear in the Traveling Cart's stock for Gold.png315-1,000g. If the player chooses the Forest Farm, walleye can also be caught in the farm pond.

name: perch
basicDescription: A freshwater fish of the winter.
longDescription: The Perch is a fish that can be found in the Mountain Lake and river, and the Cindersap Forest river and pond during the Winter. It may also be purchased from the Traveling Cart for Gold.png165-1,000g, or found in Garbage Cans during Winter.

name: carp
source: Mountain Lake, Forest Pond, Secret Woods, The Sewers, Mutant Bug Lair
basicDescription: A common pond fish.
longDescription: The Carp is a fish that can be caught during any season. The best place to try to find one may be from the west side of the mountain lake, near the mines (during Spring, Summer, or Fall). Carp can be found in the pond in Cindersap Forest during Spring, Summer, or Fall as well. It is also available during any season in the pond in the Secret Woods. in The Sewers, or the Mutant Bug Lair.

name: catfish
source: Forest Pond, River, Secret Woods, Witch's Swamp
basicDescription: An uncommon fish found in streams
longDescription: The Catfish is a fish that can be found in the river (Town+Forest) and the pond in Cindersap Forest during the Spring and Fall during rainy weather. It can also be caught in Winter if a Rain Totem is used. In the Summer, it can be found in the Secret Woods or Witch's Swamp. It can also be found in Garbage Cans in Spring, Fall, or Winter. The Catfish can be caught on the Riverlands Farm or Hill-top Farm during rainy weather as well.

name: pike
basicDescription: A freshwater fish that's difficult to catch.
longDescription: The Pike is a fish that can be found in the river (Town+Forest) and the pond in Cindersap Forest during the Summer and Winter.

name: sunfish
basicDescription: A common river fish.
longDescription: The Sunfish is a fish that can be found in the river during Spring and Summer. It may also be purchased from the Traveling Cart for Gold.png100-1,000g, or found in Garbage Cans during Spring and Summer. The Sunfish may also be caught on the Riverlands Farm or on the Hill-top Farm.

name: redMullet
basicDescription: Long ago these were kept as pets.
longDescription: The Red Mullet is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Summer and Winter.

name: herring
basicDescription: A common ocean fish.
longDescription: The Herring is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Spring and Winter.

name: eel
basicDescription: A long, slippery little fish
longDescription: The Eel is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Spring and Fall, when it's raining, from 4 PM to 2 AM. It can also rarely be found in Garbage Cans during Spring or Fall.

name: octopus
basicDescription: A mysterious and intelligent creature.
longDescription: The Octopus is a fish that can be found during Summer in the ocean and (more rarely) in Garbage Cans. It can randomly rotate into daily stock at the Traveling Cart for Gold.png450-1,000g during any season. It can also be caught in the deep-sea submarine ride at the Night Market (2% chance). This is one of the most difficult fish to catch in the game, even compared to Legendary Fish. To make it even more demanding, the odds of an octopus biting are very rare, and the window of time available to catch it is comparatively small. The most sure-fire tactic is maxing out your fishing skill, equip the Iridium Rod, eat a Dish o' The Sea, Lobster Bisque, or Fish Stew, and attach a Trap Bobber to your fishing pole. Using a combination of a maxed out fishing skill and the Iridium Rod is often insufficient.

name: redSnapper
basicDescription: A popular fish with a nice red color
longDescription: The Red Snapper is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Summer and Fall during rainy weather. It can also be caught in the ocean during Winter if a Rain Totem is used.

name: squid
basicDescription: A deep sea creature that can grow to enormous size
longDescription: The Squid is a fish that can be found in the ocean in the evening during the Winter. It can also be found in trash cans.

name: seaCucumber
basicDescription: A slippery, slimy creature found on the ocean floor.
longDescription: The Sea Cucumber is a fish that can be found in the ocean or (rarely) in Garbage Cans during the Fall and Winter. It can also be purchased from the Traveling Cart for Gold.png225-1,000g. There is a 5% chance to catch a Sea Cucumber during the deep-sea submarine ride at the Night Market during Winter 15-17.

name: superCucumber
basicDescription: A rare, purple variety of sea cucumber.
longDescription: The Super Cucumber is a fish that can be found in the evening from 6pm to 2am, in the ocean during the Summer and Fall or (rarely) in a Garbage Can during the same seasons. It can also be caught during the deep-sea submarine ride at the Night Market (4% chance).

name: ghostfish
basicDescription: A pale, blind fish found in underground lakes.
longDescription: The Ghostfish is a fish that can be found in The Mines on the 20th and 60th floor during all seasons. A Ghost may also drop a Ghostfish (8% chance) when slain.

name: stonefish
basicDescription: A bizarre fish that's shaped like a brick.
longDescription: The Stonefish is a fish that can be found in The Mines on the 20th floor during all seasons. It requires Fishing level 3, either naturally or using Fishing Buffs. It is the only fish, besides the Ghostfish, that may be caught on the 20th floor of the Mines.

name: icePip
basicDescription: A rare fish that thrives in extremely cold conditions
longDescription: The Ice Pip is a fish that can be found in the Mines on the 60th floor during all seasons. It requires fishing level 5, either naturally or using fishing Buffs. It is the only fish, besides the Ghostfish, that may be caught on the 60th floor of the Mines.

name: lavaEel
basicDescription: It can somehow survive in pools of red-hot lava.
longDescription: The Lava Eel is a fish that can be found in the Mines on the 100th floor during all seasons. It requires Fishing Level 7, either naturally or using Fishing Buffs. It is the only fish that may be caught on the 100th floor of the Mines and spawns rarely. Other than Legendary Fish, it is the second most difficult fish to catch and the fish with the highest sell price.

name: sandfish
basicDescription: It tries to hide using camouflage
longDescription: The Sandfish is a fish that can be found in The Desert during all seasons. It may randomly roll into stock at the Traveling Cart for Gold.png225-1,000g. Due to the small size of the fishing area, it may be impossible to catch gold quality fish in the desert pond.

name: scorpionCarp
basicDescription: It's like a regular carp but with a sharp stinger.
longDescription: The Scorpion Carp is a fish that can be found in The Desert during all seasons (6am-8pm)and can also randomly be purchased from the Traveling Cart for between Gold.png450-1,000g. It is the only other fish that can be caught in the Desert, besides the Sandfish. Since it is more valuable than the Sandfish, it is also more rare to get a bite from a Scorpion Carp, and the difficulty is significantly greater. Catching the Scorpion Carp requires Fishing level 4, either naturally or by using fishing Buffs. Due to the small size of the fishing area, it may be impossible to catch gold quality fish in the desert pond.

name: sturgeon
basicDescription: An ancient bottom-feeder with a dwindling population. Females can live up to 150 years.
longDescription: The Sturgeon is a fish that can be found in the mountain lake during the Summer and Winter. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays.

name: tigerTrout
basicDescription: A rare hybrid trout that cannot bear offspring of its own.
longDescription: The Tiger Trout is a fish that can be found in the river (6am-7pm) in Pelican Town and the Cindersap Forest during the Fall and Winter. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays.

name: bullhead
basicDescription: A relative of the catfish that eats a variety of foods off the lake bottom.
longDescription: The Bullhead is a fish that can be found in the mountain lake during all seasons. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays.

name: tilapia
basicDescription: A primarily vegetarian fish that prefers warm water.
longDescription: The Tilapia is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Summer and Fall. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays or at the Traveling Cart.

name: chub
basicDescription: A common freshwater fish known for its voracious appetite.
longDescription: The Chub is a fish that can be found in the mountain lake and river, as well as the Cindersap Forest river, during all seasons. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays.

name: dorado
basicDescription: A fierce carnivore with brilliant orange scales.
longDescription: The Dorado is a fish that can be found in the forest river during the Summer from 6am to 7pm. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays.

name: albacore
basicDescription: Prefers temperature 'edges' where cool and warm water meet.
longDescription: The Albacore is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Fall and Winter in the early morning and at night. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays.

name: shad
basicDescription: Lives in a school at sea, but returns to rivers to spawn.
longDescription: The Shad is a fish that can be found in the river during the Spring, Summer, and Fall during rainy weather from 9am to 2am. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays.

name: lingcod
basicDescription: A fearsome predator that will eat almost anything it can cram into its mouth.
longDescription: The Lingcod is a fish that can be found in the river or Mountain Lake during the Winter. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays or the Traveling Cart's stock for Gold.png360-1,000g.

name: halibut
basicDescription: A flat fish that lives on the ocean floor
longDescription: Halibut is a fish that can be found in the ocean during the Spring, Summer, and Winter. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays. from 6am-11am and 7pm-2am.

name: woodskip
basicDescription: A very sensitive fish that can only live in pools deep in the forest.
longDescription: The Woodskip is a fish that can be found in the Secret Woods in any season. It can also be found on The Farm, provided the player chose the Forest Farm.

name: voidSalmon
basicDescription: A salmon, twisted by void energy. The fresh meat is jet black, but rapidly turns pink when exposed to air.
longDescription: The Void Salmon is a fish that can only be found in the Witch's Swamp through the cave beside the train platform. Players must complete the quest Dark Talisman before the passage to the Witch's Swamp will open. The fish can be caught there in any season during any weather at any time. Once the cave passage has been opened, the player can return there whenever they wish.

name: slimejack
source: Mutant Bug Lair thru the Sewers.
basicDescription: He's coated in a very thick layer of slime. He keeps slipping out of your hands!
longDescription: The Slimejack is a fish that can be found only in the Mutant Bug Lair through The Sewers. Players must be on the quest Dark Talisman before the passage to the Mutant Bug Lair will open. The fish can be caught there in any season during any weather at any time. Once the passage has been opened the player can return there whenever they wish. It's challenging to fish for Slimejack, as the Mutant Flies inside the Mutant Bug Lair will continuously spawn and attack the player while fishing.

name: midnightSquid
basicDescription: A strange and mysterious denizen of the ocean's twilight depths.
longDescription: The Midnight Squid is a fish that can be found only in the submarine ride at the Night Market, which takes place at The Beach during Winter 15-17. Due to the small size of the fishing area, it may be impossible to catch gold quality fish in the submarine.

name: spookFish
basicDescription: The huge eyes can detect the faint silhouettes of prey.
longDescription: The Spook Fish is a fish that can be found only in the submarine ride at the Night Market, which takes place at The Beach during Winter 15-17. Due to the small size of the fishing area, it may be impossible to catch gold quality fish in the submarine.

name: blobfish
basicDescription: This odd creature floats above the ocean floor, consuming any edible material in its path.
longDescription: The Blobfish is a fish that can be found only in the submarine ride at the Night Market, which takes place at The Beach during Winter 15-17. Due to the small size of the fishing area, it may be impossible to catch gold quality fish in the submarine.

name: crimsonfish
basicDescription: Lives deep in the ocean but likes to lay its eggs in the warm summer water.
longDescription: The Crimsonfish is a fish that can be found in the ocean during Summer on the eastern pier of the beach (on the east side of the small bridge that requires 300 wood to repair). It requires Fishing level 5, either naturally or using Fishing Buffs. It is also known as one of the five Legendary Fish. You can only catch it once per save file.

name: angler
basicDescription: Uses a bioluminescent dangler to attract prey.
longDescription: The Angler is a fish that can be found north of Joja Mart on the wooden plank bridge during the Fall, with a fishing level of at least 3. Stand in the center of the wooden plank and cast north. (Casting south is also possible, if casting 3 or fewer tiles away from the bridge.) It is also known as one of the five Legendary Fish. You can only catch it once per save file.

name: legend
basicDescription: The king of all fish! They said he'd never be caught.
longDescription: The Legend is a fish that can be found during Spring in the mountain lake while raining. Deep water. High bite chance near the log. Requires level 10 fishing, either naturally or using a cooking buff. It is known as one of the five Legendary Fish. Unlike the other Legendary Fish which can be caught only once, you can catch as many Legend fish as you are able, within one save file. Of all the items in the game, it has the highest potential sell price per a single item.

name: glacierfish
basicDescription: Builds a nest on the underside of claciers.
longDescription: The Glacierfish is a fish that can be found in Cindersap Forest during the Winter. It requires fishing level 7, either naturally or by using fishing Buffs. It is also known as one of the five Legendary Fish. You can only catch it once per save file.

name: mutantCarp
basicDescription: The strange waters of the sewer turned this carp into a monstrosity.
longDescription: The Mutant Carp is a fish that can be found in the Sewers during all seasons. It is also known as one of the five Legendary Fish. You can only catch it once per save file. A strategy to catch this fish is to stay in the middle of the fishing minigame area until the fish begins resting somewhere else (such as the bottom or top), then stay there. The fish will move up and down continuously to shake you off and staying in the middle will allow for a slow but continuous catch.

name: lobster
basicDescription: A large ocean-dwelling crustacean with a strong tail.
longDescription: The Lobster is a fish that can be found in the ocean during any season using a Crab Pot.

name: clam
source: Crab Pots, Foraging at the Beach
basicDescription: Someone lived here once.
longDescription: The Clam is a fish that can be found in the ocean during any season using a Crab Pot. It can also be foraged from The Beach.

name: crayfish
source: Farm Ponds, River, Mountain Lake, Forest Pond, all using a Crab Pot
basicDescription: A small freshwater relative of the lobster.
longDescription: The Crayfish is a fish that can be found in freshwater during any season using a Crab Pot. It may also randomly appear in the Traveling Cart's stock for Gold.png225-1,000g.

name: crab
basicDescription: A marine crustacean with two powerful pincers.
